resources.string: Debian Kit
Readme…
Download…
Quit
Compabile CPU architecture
Cannot detect CPU_ABI. If you know, that your device has an ARM or x86 CPU, Debian Kit may run nevertheless.
CPU_ABI %s is supported. Debian Kit should run fine with this.
CPU_ABI %s is (currently) not supported. Debian Kit will not run.
Sufficient RAM memory
Error while reading /proc/meminfo.
Debian Kit should run fine with %s Mb of usable RAM.
Your Device only has %s Mb of usable RAM. You should install via an ADB console, because the Android laucher will be killed during installation.
Your Device only has %s Mb of usable RAM. Debian Kit will not run with this small amount of RAM.
Ext2""/3""/4 filesystem supported
Error while reading /proc/filesystems.
The kernel supports the %s file system. Debian Kit should run fine with this.

The kernel does not support the ext2, ext3, or ext4 file systems. Without these filesystems, Debian Kit will not run. It may be possible to install/load a kernel module to add the necessary filesystem support.
Loop mounts supported
Error while reading /proc/devices.
The kernel supports loop disks. Debian Kit should run fine with this.

The kernel does not support loop disks. Without loop disks, Debian Kit may be installed to an extra partition on an external SD card. It may also be possible to install/load a kernel module to add loop disk support.
Kernel modules supported
Kernel modules are supported. Debian Kit should run fine with this.

Kernel modules are not supported. Debian Kit should run with this, but it is not possible to add drivers to the kernel. If your kernel does not support loop disks or ext file systems, this may be a showstopper.
Files in %s/local executable
Error while reading /proc/mounts.
Android data directory (%s) not mounted with \'noexec\'. Debian Kit can be unpacked and executed to the standard directory.
Android data directory (%s) mounted with \'noexec\'. Debian Kit canot be unpacked and executed below this directory. Maybe it is possible to unpack to another location (e.g. RAM disk?).
Android data directory (%s) not found in /proc/mounts. This is unusual and may prevent you from using the Debian Kit.
Valid \'su\' command found
Detected a functioning \'su\' command. Debian Kit should run fine with this.
No functioning \'su\' command detected. This usually means that your device is not rooted and you therefore cannot use Debian-Kit.
No PATH setting in environment. This is unusual and may prevent you from using the Debian Kit.
Error while executing /system/bin/ls. This is unusual and may prevent you from using the Debian Kit.
Debian Kit already unpacked
The Debian Kit main script file (%s) was found. You may simply use Debian Kit now.
The Debian Kit main script file (%s) was not found or is not executable. Select \'Download…\' from the menu and proceed as described under \'Readme…\'.
The Debian Kit main script file (%s) is not executable.
Error while executing /system/bin/ls. This is unusual and may prevent you from using the Debian Kit.
